00099 typedef unsigned long xnarch_cpumask_t;
00100 #define xnarch_num_online_cpus()         XNARCH_NR_CPUS
00101 #define xnarch_cpu_online_map            ((1<<xnarch_num_online_cpus()) - 1)
00102 #define xnarch_cpu_set(cpu, mask)        ((mask) |= 1 << (cpu))
00103 #define xnarch_cpu_clear(cpu, mask)      ((mask) &= 1 << (cpu))
00104 #define xnarch_cpus_clear(mask)          ((mask) = 0UL)
00105 #define xnarch_cpu_isset(cpu, mask)      (!!((mask) & (1 << (cpu))))
00106 #define xnarch_cpus_and(dst, src1, src2) ((dst) = (src1) & (src2))
00107 #define xnarch_cpus_equal(mask1, mask2)  ((mask1) == (mask2))
00108 #define xnarch_cpus_empty(mask)          ((mask) == 0UL)
00109 #define xnarch_cpumask_of_cpu(cpu)       (1 << (cpu)) 
00110 #define xnarch_first_cpu(mask)           (ffnz(mask))
00111 #define XNARCH_CPU_MASK_ALL              (~0UL)
00112 
00113 #define xnarch_ullmod(ull,uld,rem)   ((*rem) = ((ull) % (uld)))
00114 #define xnarch_uldivrem(ull,uld,rem) ((u_long)xnarch_ulldiv((ull),(uld),(rem)))
00115 #define xnarch_uldiv(ull, d)         xnarch_uldivrem(ull, d, NULL)
00116 #define xnarch_ulmod(ull, d)         ({ u_long _rem;                    \
00117                                         xnarch_uldivrem(ull,d,&_rem); _rem; })
00118 
00119 static inline int xnarch_imuldiv(int i, int mult, int div)
00120 {
00121     unsigned long long ull = (unsigned long long) (unsigned) i * (unsigned) mult;
00122     return ull / (unsigned) div;
00123 }
00124 
00125 static inline unsigned long long __xnarch_ullimd(unsigned long long ull,
00126                                                  u_long m,
00127                                                  u_long d) {
00128 
00129     unsigned long long mh, ml;
00130     u_long h, l, mlh, mll, qh, r, ql;
00131 
00132     h = ull >> 32; l = ull & 0xffffffff; /* Split ull. */
00133     mh = (unsigned long long) h * m;
00134     ml = (unsigned long long) l * m;
00135     mlh = ml >> 32; mll = ml & 0xffffffff; /* Split ml. */
00136     mh += mlh;
00137     qh = mh / d;
00138     r = mh % d;
00139     ml = (((unsigned long long) r) << 32) + mll; /* assemble r and mll */
00140     ql = ml / d;
00141 
00142     return (((unsigned long long) qh) << 32) + ql;
00143 }
00144 
00145 static inline long long xnarch_llimd(long long ll, u_long m, u_long d) {
00146     if(ll < 0)
00147         return -__xnarch_ullimd(-ll, m, d);
00148     return __xnarch_ullimd(ll, m, d);
00149 }
00150 
00151 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_ullmul(unsigned long m1,
00152                                                unsigned long m2) {
00153     return (unsigned long long) m1 * m2;
00154 }
00155 
00156 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_ulldiv (unsigned long long ull,
00157                                                 unsigned long uld,
00158                                                 unsigned long *rem)
00159 {
00160     if (rem)
00161         *rem = ull % uld;
00162 
00163     return ull / uld;
00164 }

00173 typedef struct xnarchtcb {      /* Per-thread arch-dependent block */
00174 
00175     const char *name;           /* Symbolic name of thread (can be NULL) */
00176     struct xnthread *thread;    /* VM thread pointer (opaque) */
00177     void *khandle;              /* Kernel handle (opaque) */
00178     void (*entry)(void *);      /* Thread entry */
00179     void *cookie;               /* Thread cookie passed on entry */
00180     int imask;                  /* Initial interrupt mask */
00181     jmp_buf rstenv;             /* Restart context info */
00182     pthread_t thid;
00183     xncompletion_t completion;
00184 
00185     /* The following fields are not used by the Fusion skin, however
00186        they are set by the nucleus. */
00187     unsigned stacksize;         /* Aligned size of stack (bytes) */
00188     unsigned long *stackbase;   /* Stack space */
00189 
00190 } xnarchtcb_t;

00214 static inline int __attribute__ ((unused))
00215 xnarch_read_environ (const char *name, const char **ptype, void *pvar)
00216 
00217 {
00218     char *value;
00219 
00220     if (*ptype == NULL)
00221         return 0;       /* Already read in */
00222 
00223     value = getenv(name);
00224 
00225     if (!value)
00226         return -1;
00227 
00228     if (**ptype == 's')
00229         *((char **)pvar) = value;
00230     else if (strstr(*ptype,"int"))
00231         *((int *)pvar) = atoi(value);
00232     else if (strstr(*ptype,"long"))
00233         *((u_long *)pvar) = (u_long)atol(value);
00234 
00235     *ptype = NULL;
00236 
00237     return 1;
00238 }
00239 
00240 static int inline xnarch_lock_irq (void)
00241 {
00242     return xnarch_atomic_xchg(&uvm_irqlock,1);
00243 }
00244 
00245 static inline void xnarch_unlock_irq (int x)
00246 {
00247     extern int uvm_irqpend;
00248 
00249     if (!x && uvm_irqlock)
00250         {
00251         if (xnarch_atomic_xchg(&uvm_irqpend,0))
00252             uvm_thread_release(&uvm_irqlock);
00253         else
00254             uvm_irqlock = 0;
00255         }
00256 }

00268 #ifdef XENO_INTR_MODULE
00269 
00270 int uvm_irqlock = 0;    /* =1 whenever IRQs are off. */
00271 
00272 int uvm_irqpend = 0;    /* =1 whenever IRQs are pending. */
00273 
00274 void xnarch_sync_irq (void) /* Synchronization point for IRQ servers. */
00275 
00276 {
00277     if (uvm_irqlock)
00278         /* IRQs are off. Set the IRQ pending flag and go to sleep,
00279            waiting for the IRQs to be unmasked. */
00280         uvm_thread_hold(&uvm_irqpend);
00281 }
00282

00284                                    void (*handler)(unsigned irq,
00285                                                    void *cookie),
00286                                    int (*ackfn)(unsigned irq),
00287                                    void *cookie)
00288 {
00289     return -ENOSYS;
00290 }

00345 static void xnarch_restart_handler (int sig) {
00346 
00347     longjmp(uvm_current->rstenv,1);
00348 }
00349 
00350 int main (int argc, char *argv[])
00351 
00352 {
00353     struct sigaction sa;
00354     int err;
00355 
00356     if (geteuid() !=0)
00357         {
00358         fprintf(stderr,"This program must be run with root privileges.\n");
00359         exit(1);
00360         }
00361 
00362     err = __fusion_sys_init();
00363 
00364     if (err)
00365         {
00366         fprintf(stderr,"sys_init() failed: %s\n",strerror(-err));
00367         exit(2);
00368         }
00369 
00370     err = __fusion_skin_init();
00371 
00372     if (err)
00373         {
00374         fprintf(stderr,"skin_init() failed: %s\n",strerror(-err));
00375         exit(3);
00376         }
00377 
00378     err = __fusion_user_init();
00379 
00380     if (err)
00381         {
00382         fprintf(stderr,"user_init() failed: %s\n",strerror(-err));
00383         exit(4);
00384         }
00385 
00386     /* Lock all the memory space which has been allocated from the
00387        user initialization code. We leave MCL_FUTURE in the hands of
00388        the user, since use of mapped I/O memory might require
00389        decoupling the locking operations as follows:
00390        mlockall(MCL_CURRENT) + mmap() + mlockall(MCL_FUTURE). */
00391     mlockall(MCL_CURRENT);
00392 
00393     sa.sa_handler = &xnarch_restart_handler;
00394     sigemptyset(&sa.sa_mask);
00395     sa.sa_flags = SA_RESTART;
00396     sigaction(XNARCH_SIG_RESTART,&sa,NULL);
00397 
00398     for (;;)
00399         uvm_thread_idle(&uvm_irqlock);
00400 
00401     __fusion_user_exit();
00402     __fusion_skin_exit();
00403     __fusion_sys_exit();
00404 
00405     exit(0);
00406 }
00407 
00408 #endif  /* !XENO_MAIN_MODULE */

00429 #ifdef XENO_POD_MODULE
00430 
00431 extern void *uvm_timer_handle;
00432 
00433 xnsysinfo_t uvm_info;
00434 
00435 xnarchtcb_t *uvm_root;
00436 
00437 xnarchtcb_t *uvm_current;
00438 
00439 struct xnarch_tick_parms {
00440     unsigned long nstick;
00441     void (*tickhandler)(void);
00442     xncompletion_t completion;
00443 };
00444 
00445 /*
00446  * NOTE: System-level shadow priorities underlying the UVM threads are
00447  * defined as follows:
00448  *
00449  * - uvm-root = prio_min(SCHED_FIFO)
00450  * - uvm-<user> = prio_min(SCHED_FIFO) + 1
00451  * - uvm-timer = prio_min(SCHED_FIFO) + 2
00452  */
00453 
00454 static void *xnarch_timer_thread (void *cookie)
00455 
00456 {
00457     struct xnarch_tick_parms *p = (struct xnarch_tick_parms *)cookie;
00458     void (*tickhandler)(void);
00459     struct sched_param param;
00460     unsigned long nstick;
00461     long err;
00462 
00463     param.sched_priority = sched_get_priority_min(SCHED_FIFO) + 2;
00464     sched_setscheduler(0,SCHED_FIFO,&param);
00465 
00466     /* Copy the following values laid into our parent's stack before
00467        it is unblocked from the completion by uvm_thread_create(). */
00468     tickhandler = p->tickhandler;
00469     nstick = p->nstick;
00470 
00471     uvm_thread_create("uvm-timer",NULL,&p->completion,&uvm_timer_handle);
00472 
00473     err = uvm_thread_barrier(); /* Wait for start. */
00474 
00475     if (!err)
00476         err = uvm_thread_set_periodic(0,nstick);
00477 
00478     if (err)
00479         pthread_exit((void *)err);
00480 
00481     for (;;)
00482         {
00483         if (uvm_thread_wait_period() == -EWOULDBLOCK) /* Timer killed? */
00484             break;
00485 
00486         xnarch_sync_irq();
00487         tickhandler();
00488         }
00489 
00490     pthread_exit(NULL);
00491 }
00492 
00493 static inline int xnarch_start_timer (unsigned long nstick,
00494                                       void (*tickhandler)(void))
00495 {
00496     struct xnarch_tick_parms parms;
00497     pthread_attr_t thattr;
00498     pthread_t thid;
00499     int err;
00500 
00501     if (nstick == 0) /* UVM does not provide oneshot timing. */
00502         return -ENODEV;
00503 
00504     /* However, if oneshot timing is available at system level, use it
00505        so that we can provide a better resolution for virtual machine
00506        ticks. Otherwise, ask for plain periodic mode, hoping that the
00507        period given will be compatible with Linux's own requirements
00508        wrt its jiffy-based timer. */
00509 
00510 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_APERIODIC_TIMER
00511     err = uvm_timer_start(0);
00512 #else /* !CONFIG_RTAI_HW_APERIODIC_TIMER */
00513     err = uvm_timer_start(nstick);
00514 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_APERIODIC_TIMER */
00515 
00516     if (err)
00517         return err;
00518 
00519     parms.nstick = nstick;
00520     parms.tickhandler = tickhandler;
00521     parms.completion.syncflag = 0;
00522     parms.completion.pid = -1;
00523 
00524     pthread_attr_init(&thattr);
00525     pthread_attr_setdetachstate(&thattr,PTHREAD_CREATE_DETACHED);
00526     pthread_create(&thid,&thattr,&xnarch_timer_thread,&parms);
00527 
00528     err = uvm_thread_sync(&parms.completion);
00529 
00530     if (err == 0)
00531         uvm_thread_start(uvm_timer_handle);
00532 
00533     return err;
00534 }
00535 
00536 static inline void xnarch_leave_root(xnarchtcb_t *rootcb) {
00537 }
00538 
00539 static inline void xnarch_enter_root(xnarchtcb_t *rootcb) {
00540 }
00541 
00542 static inline void xnarch_switch_to (xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00543                                      xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb)
00544 {
00545     uvm_current = in_tcb;
00546     uvm_thread_activate(in_tcb->khandle,out_tcb->khandle);
00547 }
00548 
00549 static inline void xnarch_finalize_and_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb,
00550                                                xnarchtcb_t *next_tcb)
00551 {
00552     uvm_current = next_tcb;
00553     uvm_thread_cancel(dead_tcb->khandle,next_tcb->khandle);
00554 }
00555 
00556 static inline void xnarch_finalize_no_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb)
00557 
00558 {
00559     uvm_thread_cancel(dead_tcb->khandle,NULL);
00560 }
00561 
00562 static inline void xnarch_init_root_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00563                                          struct xnthread *thread,
00564                                          const char *name)
00565 {
00566     struct sched_param param;
00567     int err;
00568 
00569     param.sched_priority = sched_get_priority_min(SCHED_FIFO);
00570     sched_setscheduler(0,SCHED_FIFO,&param);
00571     err = uvm_system_info(&uvm_info);
00572 
00573     if (err)
00574         {
00575         fprintf(stderr,"UVM init failed: %s\n",strerror(-err));
00576         exit(1);
00577         }
00578 
00579     uvm_thread_shadow("uvm-root",tcb,&tcb->khandle);
00580     tcb->name = name;
00581     uvm_root = uvm_current = tcb;
00582 }
00583 
00584 static void *xnarch_thread_trampoline (void *cookie)
00585 
00586 {
00587     xnarchtcb_t *tcb = (xnarchtcb_t *)cookie;
00588     struct sched_param param;
00589     long err;
00590 
00591     if (!setjmp(tcb->rstenv))
00592         {
00593         param.sched_priority = sched_get_priority_min(SCHED_FIFO) + 1;
00594         sched_setscheduler(0,SCHED_FIFO,&param);
00595         uvm_thread_create(tcb->name,tcb,&tcb->completion,&tcb->khandle);
00596         err = uvm_thread_barrier();     /* Wait for start. */
00597         if (err)
00598             pthread_exit((void *)err);
00599         }
00600 
00601     xnarch_setimask(tcb->imask);
00602 
00603     xnpod_welcome_thread(tcb->thread);
00604 
00605     tcb->entry(tcb->cookie);
00606 
00607     pthread_exit(NULL);
00608 }
00609 
00610 static inline void xnarch_init_thread (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00611                                        void (*entry)(void *),
00612                                        void *cookie,
00613                                        int imask,
00614                                        struct xnthread *thread,
00615                                        char *name)
00616 {
00617     pthread_attr_t thattr;
00618 
00619     if (tcb->khandle)   /* Restarting thread */
00620         {
00621         pthread_kill(tcb->thid,XNARCH_SIG_RESTART);
00622         return;
00623         }
00624 
00625     tcb->imask = imask;
00626     tcb->entry = entry;
00627     tcb->cookie = cookie;
00628     tcb->thread = thread;
00629     tcb->name = name;
00630     tcb->completion.syncflag = 0;
00631     tcb->completion.pid = -1;
00632 
00633     pthread_attr_init(&thattr);
00634     pthread_attr_setdetachstate(&thattr,PTHREAD_CREATE_DETACHED);
00635     pthread_create(&tcb->thid,&thattr,&xnarch_thread_trampoline,tcb);
00636     uvm_thread_sync(&tcb->completion);
00637 }
00638 
00639 static inline void xnarch_enable_fpu(xnarchtcb_t *current_tcb) {
00640     /* Handled by the in-kernel nucleus */
00641 }
00642 
00643 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu(xnarchtcb_t *tcb) {
00644     /* Handled by the in-kernel nucleus */

00696 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_tsc_to_ns (unsigned long long tsc) {
00697

00699     return uvm_timer_tsc2ns(tsc,&ns) ? 0 : ns;

00708 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_time (void)
00709 
00710 {
00711     nanotime_t t;
00712     uvm_timer_read(&t);
00713     return t;
00714 }

00716 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_tsc (void)

00728 static inline void xnarch_halt (const char *emsg) {
00729     fprintf(stderr,"UVM fatal: %s\n",emsg);
00730     fflush(stderr);
00731     exit(99);
00732 }
